    • Method Detail

      • getStatisticsForHourAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStatisticsForHourAsStream(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the statistics for the hour of the given date. This is a convenience method for: getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream(TimeBucketUtils.forHour(date))
        Parameters:
        date - the date to format as an hour time bucket.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the statistics as XML.
        See Also:
        getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream(String), TimeBucketUtils.forHour(Date)

      • getStatisticsForMinuteAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStatisticsForMinuteAsStream(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the statistics for the minute of the given date. This is a convenience method for: getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream(TimeBucketUtils.forMinute(date))
        Parameters:
        date - the date to format as a minute time bucket.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the statistics as XML.
        See Also:
        getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream(String), TimeBucketUtils.forMinute(Date)

      • getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStatisticsForTimeBucketAsStream(java.lang.String timeBucket)
        Gets the statistics for the given time bucket, as a stream. A time bucket can be either an hour or a minute of any day, in the form of yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH for hour or yy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm for minute.

        API Call: GET /metering/stats?time_bucket={timeBucket}

        Parameters:
        timeBucket - the time bucket for which to retrieve the stats.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the statistics as XML. This must be closed by the client in order to release the connection.
